March 11, 2014 Poughkeepsie Journal P.O. Box 1231 Poughkeepsie, NY 12602 Attention: News Editor RE:Meeting of Roose- velt Fire District Please take notice that a special meeting of the Board of Fire Commis- sioners of the Roosevelt Fire District has been scheduled for Thursday, March 13, 2014. All meetings of the Roosevelt Fire District are open to the public. The meeting will be held in the Board Room at Roosevelt Engine Co. #2, 265 Cream Street, Poughkeepsie, N.Y. The meeting time is 7:00 P.M. This notification is be- ing given to the news media pursuant to the provisions of section 94 of the Public Officers Law of the state of New York. By order of the Board of Fire Commissioners of the Roosevelt Fire Dis- trict. Lori Hicks District Secretary Roosevelt Fire District 6327

NOTICE OF SPECIAL MEETING, BUDGET VOTE AND ELECTION OF TRUSTEES HOWLAND PUBLIC LIBRARY NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN, that a vote will be taken upon the fol- lowing proposition to appropriate the funds necessary to meet the estimated expenditures of the Howland Public Library for the 2014- 2015 fiscal year to be held at the Howland Public Library, 313 Main Street, Beacon, New York, on May 1, 2014, between the hours of 12:00 noon and 8:00 p.m.: Proposition #1 “Shall the sum of $908,802.00 be appro- priated for the annual support of the Howland Public Library for the fiscal year 2014- 2015 and shall the Bea- con City School District be authorized to levy the taxes necessary to raise such amount?“ NOTICE IS ALSO GIVEN that at the same time and place, a vote to elect one (1) member to the Board of Trustees for a term of one (1) year and two (2) mem- bers to the Board of Trustees for a term of five (5) years, will also occur. NOTICE IS ALSO GIVEN that petitions nominat- ing candidates for the office of trustee of the Howland Public Library must be filed with the Library Election Clerk not later than 5:00 p.m., Tuesday, April 1, 2014. Each petition must be directed to the Library Election Clerk, must be signed by at least 25 qualified voters of the Howland Public Library District, must state the residence of each sign- er, and must state the name and residence of the candidate. Petition forms may be obtained from the Library week- days between 9:30 a.m. and 5:30 p.m. NOTICE IS ALSO GIVEN that the Board of Regis- tration will meet on April 24, 2014, between the hours of 1:00 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. for the purpose of preparing a register of the qualified voters of such Library District at the offices of the Howland Public Li- brary, 313 Main Street, Beacon, New York. Anyone not presently registered will be regis- tered in accordance with Section 2014 of the Education Law. Any person shall be entitled to have his/her name placed upon such regis- ter, provided that at such meeting of the Board of Registration, he/she is known or pro- ven to the satisfaction of such Board of Regis- tration to be then or thereafter entitled to vote at the school meeting or election for which such register is prepared. Voters registered for general elections under Article 5 of the Election Law are eligible to vote at the May 1, 2014, bud- get vote and election without further regis- tration. Voters who have been previously registered for any annu- al or special meeting or election and who have voted at any such annu- al or special meeting or election held or con- ducted during the last four calendar years pre- ceding 2014 are eligible to vote at the May 1, 2014, budget vote and election without further registration. The register prepared will be filed in the office of the Library and will be open for inspection by any qualified voter of the Library District between the hours of 9:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. on each of the five days prior to the election. The register will also be available for inspection on the day of the elec- tion at the polling place. NOTICE IS FURTHER GIVEN that applications for absentee ballots may be applied for at the Library office. If the ballot is to be mailed to the voter, the com- pleted application must be received by the Li- brary Election Clerk no later than 4:00 p.m., prevailing time, seven (7) days before the an- nual library budget vote and election. If the bal- lot is to be delivered personally to the voter, the completed applica- tion must be received by the Library Election Clerk no later than 5:00 p.m., prevailing time, one day before the an- nual library budget vote and election. A list of all persons to whom ab- sentee ballots are is- sued will be available for inspection week- days between 9:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m., prevail- ing time, at the Library office on each of the five (5) days before the annual district vote and election. By order of the Board of Trustees of the Howl- and Public Library Julie Beyer Library Election Clerk 5839

PUBLIC HEARING TOWN OF LAGRANGE The LaGrange Planning Board hereby gives no- tice of a preliminary public hearing to be held on Thursday, March 20th, 2014, in the LaGrange Town Hall, 120 Stringham Road, La- Grangeville NY at ap- proximately 7:00 p.m. or as soon thereafter as it may appear on the agenda, for the purpose of considering the pro- posed 5 Lot Subdivision, special use permit, and wetland permit for the Lands of Carrington Construction Corp. known as Whispering Pines Subdivision con- taining 51.6 acres, lo- cated on Route 55 in the Town of LaGrange. The Planning Board, will at said time and place, continue to hear any and all pertinent comments from the public as they relate to this proposed project. All maps and related documents are on file in the office of the La- Grange Planning Board for inspection during regular working hours. By: Ms. Stacy Olyha Chairman Planning Board of the Town of LaGrange Date: March 10, 2014 6175

REQUEST FOR BIDS NOTICE The Purchasing Agent, County of Dutchess, Poughkeepsie, New York, hereby invites the submission of sealed bids for: Bid #RFB-DCP- 11-14 HARDWARE SUPPLIES Bids will be received until 2:00 p.m. on the 3rd day of April 2014 at the Dutchess County Di- vision of Central Serv- ices, 27 High Street, Poughkeepsie, New York 12601. Specifications and bid forms may be obtained by visiting our web site http://www.dutchessny .gov and choosing the Quick Links for “Bidding and RFPs“. TO BE PUBLISHED ON: March 13, 2014 Notice is hereby given that a Public Hearing will be held by the Zon- ing Board of Appeals of the Town of Pawling, on Monday, March 24, 2014 at 7:00 P.M., or as soon there- after, in the Town Hall, 160 Charles Colman Blvd., Pawling, NY upon the following matter: APPLICATION BY: Michael & Ileana Cara- fas, 2 Caroline Dr, Pat- terson, NY 12563 Pursuant of Article V of the Town Code of Pawl- ing. Appeal is made here- with for a Variance to the Zoning Ordinances (local laws) 215-34 L (3) (a) Driveway grades. PROPERTY LOCATION: Lake Drive, Holmes, NY 12531 GRID NUMBER: 11- 6855-00-271366 BOUNDED ON THE NORTH BY: John & Kath- leen Paugh; Henry J. Showah BOUNDED ON THE SOUTH BY: Putnam County Line BOUNDED ON THE EAST BY: Presbyterian Con- ference Assn. Inc BOUNDED ON THE WEST BY: Lake Drive (Pvt Road/ROW); James Edward Craig; Con- stance Farrell; Henry A. Dorocho- vich & Julie A. Johns; Stephen Davanzo; Orsie Watts; Robert J George & Patrice Freeburger; Jennifer Monaco A VARIANCE TO THE ZONING ORDINANCE (L- OCAL LAW) AND TOWN LAW IS REQUESTED FOR THIS REASON: 215-34 L (3) (a) Drive- way grades: Maximum grade for any new driveway to a single family dwelling is 10%, the proposed driveway grade is 12.5%, a vari- ance of 2.5% in grade is requested. Said Board of Appeals will at said time and place hear all persons in support of such ap- plication and any in ob- jection thereto. Interested parties may appear in person or by agent. ZONING BOARD OF AP- PEALS 6113
